Reviews.Title: “perfect small hotel”
Reviews.Author: val_marriott
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location in beautiful St Germain-des-Pres . Lots of excellent restaurants and wine bars, interesting shops and lovely churches - all within walking distance of the Seine and the centre of Paris. A very warm welcome from the hotel staff , clean,quiet and well-appointed room with efficient lift. Breakfast served in the conservatory with large healthy choice of fare.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable, good value hotel close to Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: JatandGst
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Great position to tour Paris, 15 minutes walk to Louvre. . Clean modern bathroom with plenty of hot water. Ask for room overlooking courtyard which is quieter than street side. Plenty of bistro style restaurants nearby and of course the Latin Quarter which is fun to visit. Helpful staff and breakfast room (not included in price). Soundproofing between our room and next was not what it should be but not a huge problem. Would really recommend for a visit to the tourist sites in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the location”
Reviews.Author: Julie U
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of our honeymoon and while the location was ideal, the hotel itself was sparse and not what we were expecting. We could barely fit our luggage in the room around the bed and the decor was very dated. Everything was very clean though. Furthermore, the staff was absolutely wonderful, very friendly and helpful which made our stay better. Overall, for a good value in a great location, this hotel is fine, but don't expect luxury or a lot of extra amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful in the 6th”
Reviews.Author: Alan K
Reviews.Content: Hotel La Perle is a gem tucked away on a side street in the 6th. Close to St. Sulpice, shopping, restaurants and all of those things you come to Paris to enjoy. Rooms are small but are being updated to provide for more space and excellent en-suite facilities. Brick and morter will make a building but what sets La Perle apart is the staff. Lydia, Leila and Ania provide a welcoming, fun and caring atmosphere that provides the luster to the "Perle."

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure!”
Reviews.Author: LaineyBlueMountains
Reviews.Content: We were not disappointed! This is a clean and cosy hotel in a central and convenient location with staff who were at hand to assist in every possible way. We stayed for three nights and enjoyed the continental breakfast every morning. On the second morning, the demand for breakfast exhausted the fruit supply and on the next day, the attendant made certain that there was copious amounts available, particularly for my parents who find this an essential part of their diet. The only downside is the noisy street at the front of the hotel, which is located opposite "Chez George", a lively pub from which the clientele spills into the tiny street in the wee hours of the morning. Much later, either a street sweeper or garbage truck rattles up the street with annoying reliability, from which we were fortunately able to return to sleep. These did not spoil our stay nor our opinion of the hotel nor it's location. As other writers have suggested, a courtyard room would probably be more secluded. Regardless, we would have no hesitation in recommending the Hotel la Perle as value for money, in a great location and with fabulous staff!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Knox-j-s
Reviews.Content: Hotel La Perle Paris is situated in the 6th district which is in Left Bank. Rooms are spacious, continental breakfast to start the day, staff very attentive and the hotel itself situated in walking distance of all the sigths Paris has to offer. Third time to Paris and would highly recommend this hotel. I booked on the net with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: DJSCMac
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the Latin quarter, a great place to stay. Near the metro, within walking distance to a lot of sites, and tons of shops/ restaurants. It got a tad noisy at night sometimes, but nothing unbearable. The breakfast was great every morning and the staff were so very helpful and nice. We walked alot and always felt safe. Absolutely loved this hotel. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: IRONGX
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with very attentive front desk staff. Amine was especially helpful during our stay and we already have reservations for next summer 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could do better”
Reviews.Author: Jules S
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel four or five times and always been very happy with our stay. But last weekend we came back at 5.30pm after trudging around Paris looking forward to a nice drink in the Hotel La Perle bar by their new modern fireplace when we were greeted by a dark, non lit dining area and a closed bar. The Hotel guide in our room stated the bar should be open every day until midnight, well it wasn't. If this is a new policy I think we might be looking for a different hotel next year when we return for our once or twice yearly visit. A drink in the evening is a crucial part of a break in any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden but close to where it's at”
Reviews.Author: mitchellinx
Reviews.Content: Really loved this Hotel the location is great and had everything we needed. It's not luxury but really comfortable. The staff are excellent and really add that bit extra that makes the difference. Try it you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: JP2065
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days in a standard room. The location is just superb 5 mins from 2 metro stops plus you are smack bang in the middle of the restaurant/cafe/shop actions of the Latin quarter. Room size is fair but comfortable. But what we are most impressed about the hotel is the service. We had a few misshaps in the hotel and they were all sorted with patience and the least of fuss. For example when we arrived on the first night the bathroom wasn't serviced. We were upgraded to a delux room straightaway. It could have been a negative experience if not for Amin, Frank and the rest of the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Part of Town, Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rkbaron
Reviews.Content: Despite its outstanding location, I would not recommend this hotel. I stayed for 5 nights last month and on the third night we came home one evening to a leak in the bathroom. The attendant working that night said that he could move us rooms (only for that night and then back to the original room the following night) or that they manager would comp us for the inconvenience. We decided to just clean up the mess ourselves instead of moving all of our stuff for just one night and were hopefully going to get comp'ed the next day. The next day we asked the manager and explained the situation and the staff just kept saying they would get back to us and never did. The hotel allowed us to stay in a mildew smelling room (the carpet and bathroom smelled because of the leak) and only after asking the staff 10 times did they offer to give us 20 euros back. I have complained since I have left Paris for the two night comp'ed as I was promised but they refuse to respond. With so many options in Paris, there is absolutely no need to stay at this place where they clearly don't care about the well-being of their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a funky part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: cgra_dk
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location in the latin quarter of Paris. If you travel to Paris to experience culture, shopping and ambience this is the place to stay. The small and clean hotel with a friendly staff is close to good bars and bistros.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied all our needs in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kez1955
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a week and would not hesitate to return. Excellent location, so many sights within walking distance, and a very clean, comfortable, room. Hotel was quiet and yet close to lots of restaurants. A charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “just needed a room at the last minute!”
Reviews.Author: Funtraveller62
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a last minute booking so we could be in Paris our last night after a week in the Loire Valley. We looked at trip advisor reviews and were able to get a last minute room based on a cancellation. This hotel is a gem! I would stay there for a return visit. The other reviews point out that the location is great and I agree. Canettes is a small street that is perfectly located for dining and shopping. In addition, the down comforters and pillows and beds are superior to many other hotels I have stayed in in Paris. If street noise is a problem, ask for a courtyard room, which we had and it was divinely quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Windsurferman
Reviews.Content: Cannot recommend it enough. Great location, staff and the rooms were clean and of a nice size.

Reviews.Title: “"The paris hotel of our dreams"”
Reviews.Author: nzs
Reviews.Content: The St. Germaine de Pres area is our favorite neighborhood in Paris and the Rue de Cannettes our favorite street in that neighborhood. For years we have admired the outside of the Hotel La Perle on that street and and wondered what it would be like to stay there. On previous occasions it was out of our price range, but this time it was quite reasonable at 140 Euros per night including breakfast. We were delighted to discover that it was everything we hoped it would be: an intimate and romantic little Paris hotel in a wonderful neighborhood, with outstanding service. The two men who worked the front desk (Teddy and Amine) could not have been more helpful or more courteous. In sum, this hotel has our wholehearted endorsement and we will stay there every time we go to Paris, if it is affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Pearl in Saint Germain des Pres”
Reviews.Author: GuaguaBeijing
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the good feedback from other reviews here. Our four nights stay at this hotel was very pleasant one. Compared to other hotels on the Boulevard or on rue Jacob that stayed before, this hotel is very competitive both for its service and money value. Our room number 1 is the only room on ground floor, with easy access to the dining room and the lovely courtyard. Very clean room, with very bright bathroom facing also the court. The only down side is during this summer vacation period, we feel that some house keeping staffs are just part time replacement, and sometime the room can't be cleaned at the time wished. This being said, hotel staffs are very friendly, by helping arranging a sofa bed for our young kid free of charge. Wonderful location for shopping and big choices of restaurants both on this rue DES Canettes or around Place Saint Germain (au Petit Zinc, that you need absolutely to go). Will come back next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: rob106106
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable 3 night stay at the Hotel La Perle, the room, if a little small, was very clean and well maintained. The hotel is well positioned in the nice location of St Germain with lots to see and do in the surrounding area. It is only a short distance to the main attractions of the Louvre, Eiffel Tower and Pantheon, all of which we walked to, however the metro connections were ample too. The hotel staff were very welcoming and happy to help with any requests you may have, and although there was some maintenance work going on during our stay I dont feel that it affected our pleasant experience. Would definitely return to this hotel if we venture to Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and friendly”
Reviews.Author: travelbug0164
Reviews.Content: The location is great as there are shops and restaurants right on the street and it is walking distance to the Louvre and Notre Dame. However, beware of the downside to the fact that you are right in the middle of the action. We had two rooms, both King. One on the street side and one on the courtyard side. The courtyard side room was lovely as you could come back from a busy day and open the window and relax and it was quiet at night. The other room was on the street, which was very narrow, so the view was of another building wall. More importantly, the Parisians were partying every night well in to the night out in the street. If street noise bothers you, this will really annoy you. The hotel staff were very friendly and all fluent in English and always willing to answer a question about where to eat or to call a cab for the airport. However, there is no concierge so this is probably not place for you if you need alot of attention from a concierge. Rooms were spacious and clean. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “My second visit”
Reviews.Author: Robin90
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Perle last summer and when I decided to return to Paris again the first order of business was to book this same hotel. I was not disappointed--the hotel is lovely, small and intimate yet all of the amenities. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful--I remembered all of them. We stayed again in the deluxe double room facing the courtyard--there are large windows in both the room and bathroom--it is so nice to have the option of the windows. The AC worked very well too. Probably the best part of staying here is the location. You walk out the door and there are small and wonderful restaurants within steps of the hotel. Also darling shops with a variety of shoes, clothing, bags, etc. There is no need to go elsewhere at night as the restaurants in the area are wonderful. It is easy to take buses or the metra anywhere, and again the staff is very helpful and accomodating. I travel often in Europe and Hotel La Perle is definitely one of my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “A Pearl”
Reviews.Author: PithyPacky
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a charming street in the 6th arr. Superb service. Three metro stations very close. Great area with lots of shops, restaurants, and cafe's. Excellent value. Only complaint is WiFi. WiFi slow and sporadic. Repeat: fab location!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & Charming Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nojakeno
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel quite by accident and it was absolutely the best choice for us (just don't take the metro from the airport). The front desk personnel were helpful & spoke excellent English though they didn't necessarily go out of their way. The breakfast was divine - they brought me steamed milk without having to ask for it once I had my cup of coffee once they knew what I liked. The bar is vvery small & quiet-just perfect after a day with crowds. I have recommended it to various people and would love to return someday. There's a very good Italian restaurant directly across the street - very cozy! Our room was small but very comfortable (we requested inner courtyard) & WiFi was always good.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location!”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneGazza
Reviews.Content: Situated just off Blvd St Germain right in middle of restaurants, shops etc. Short walk to beautiful Jardine de Luxembourg, River Seine, Notre Damme, Louve (excuse the spelling). Good size rooms, comfortable, lovely indoor courtyard. Staff very helpful with restaurant & travel tips. For a 4 night stay in this lovely city great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: mvo168
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights - it met all our needs - free wifi, elevator, strong water pressure with hot water. Location is superb - close by to wonderful bakeries, pattisseries, cafes, restaurants, etc. Highly recommended :) Request for a room facing the inner courtyard for a quiet night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug963
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a holiday with a night life, you want to stay in the Latin Quarter -- great restaurants, great shopping, great street life. And Hotel La Perle is in the middle of it all. Newly updated, this hotel is small, but quaint and pretty. The staff were extremely helpful, friendly and kind. But the greatest thing about this hotel is the bartender, Eddie!!!! What a gem. Would DEFINITELY stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very quaint hotel in wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: hutchins77
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I had 5 rooms in this hotel in April 2011 and loved it! It is in a PERFECT location as others have noted. Great nightlife (the tip about asking for a room not facing the street is particularly important if you don't like street noise -- they literally party in the street until 2am even during the week), great shopping, great restaurants and bars. Very close to 3 different Metro stops. Walkable to Notre Dame and lots of other places. The hotel itself is really cute. The staff is very helpful. The breakfast is fairly standard (croissants, meats, cheeses) and good. This is not a luxury hotel -- the rooms are simply furnished. It's clean and has lots of character, but it is not at all fancy. We found the showers to be very good and always had plenty of hot water. WI-fi worked great for us. With respect to the room size, it varies greatly. As I said, we had 5 rooms. The executive size was good for sharing with a friend -- still very small but had a couch and a table which gave us some additional room. The regular rooms were not all the same size. Some were tiny, others were typically small. I would highly recommend this hotel. It's a quaint hotel with a great value in a wonderful location. If you want something fancy or large rooms, however, La Perle isn't for you.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed, charming hotel, on a street with lots of night life”
Reviews.Author: Tjr121
Reviews.Content: Terrific location between St. Germain des Pres and St. Suplice. The hotel has an attractive lobby, bar and breakfast room with outdoor patio; also an elevator, which most likely contributes to its 3 star rating. Our small room was serviceably furnished with comfortable bed, nice bedding, a well-appointed modern bathroom, albeit with a small, cylindrically-shaped shower. There was barely any room between the foot of the bed and the small desk. Be careful of losing items behind the minibar (if you use it as a shelf). People, particularly young partiers, fill the street, Rue des Canettes, till the wee hours of the morning. Fortunately, the room is well insulated with soundproof windows, and the heating and cooling system provided good ventilation. No complaints here. I do complain about the lack of wifi Internet security. There is no password protection, although hotel binder in the room tells you to call for the login information. None of the desk people understood the significance of such lack of Internet security, and thought that because access was limited to hotel proximity, everything was fine. All of the other hotels we stayed at on our trip had room or floor level security -- and none of them were 3 stars.Concierge service was mixed. The evening before we left, we asked the desk clerk if we could get a taxi to the train station the next day. The next morning, when we called for the taxi, the very helpful and knowledgeable day concierge told us the and the streets were closed because of the Paris Marathon, and a taxi would be of no help. Fortunately we were able to take the Metro to the station, but I'm assuming the 3rd star has some bearing on service, and that the evening clerk should have been aware of this. There is a computer for public use in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: marv_clark
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the La Perle from April 27 thru May 3rd. The hotel staff was excellent. Very accommodating and extremely helpful. The room was very clean and although a little noisy in the late evening (we were on the first floor, street side). We are sound sleepers so it was not that bad. Actually we liked the sound of the young people having fun and enjoying life. The location was outstanding. We could literally walk to every site without much of a problem. Many good cafe's and restaurants were very close by. The bed was comfortable and the comforters were great. The breakfast was very satisfying and the bar was adequate. Although it could have been open a little later. When we return to Paris, La Perle will be our home base. Thanks to all the staff who helped us immensly during our stay...A job, well done...P.S. try the crepes down the block, great snack late a night...

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nonrevver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nestled on Rue de Cannettes which is a nice bustling little street. There are shops, restaurants, creperies, and bars on the street which provide a good mix of liveliness. I didn't feel it was super touristy though and it's got easy foot and metro access to the rest of Paris. Area is populated so it felt perfectly safe at night. We got breakfast downstairs at the nice little skylighted bar area in the morning which made a perfect start to the day. The room was okay (2 twin beds stuck together), but be warned that it is difficult to charge your electronic devices. They have special outlets that don't work with adapters or converters. The only thing you can do is plug it into a unit they have in the bathroom for electric razors and hairdryers, but there's a catch: you actually have to wind it up to get power flowing and it maxes out at 15 minutes. So you'll actually have to keep resetting it every 15 minutes keep charging and can only do 1 device at a time. Our room was on the top (5th) floor, but at night we could still hear street noise if you have the window open (downside of a lively area). Fantastic location, but average room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: JCR2009
Reviews.Content: Hotel La Perle is well located in Saint-Germain-des-Pres in an area of many shops and restaurants and within walking distance of many of the top sights in Paris. We had a classic double room which was very small and was equipped with two twin beds rather than a double without room for two people to pass between the beds and the walls. The beds seemed even smaller than a normal twin and were of only average quality. However, the rooms were clean and the included breakfast was more than adequate and served in a nice enclosed courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but with few disappointments”
Reviews.Author: GreenApple07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel La Perle for 3 nights in their Classic Double Room. The location of the hotel is excellent - it is located within 2 blocks of two metro stations and is literally 2 blocks away from Boulevard St. Germain. There are lots of cafes, restaurants and shops (boutique and brand names) all within walking distance to the hotel. We shopped and walked back to the hotel to drop off our shopping bags before continuing on with our day which was really helpful, especially since we were right in the middle of the winter sales. The complimentary breakfast was a nice touch - you get a glass of orange juice, coffee, croissants, yogurt, cheese and fruits. However, the hotel was not without any disappointments. Firstly, the free wi-fi did not work 2 days out of the 3 we spent at the hotel. There is a complimentary computer that you can use for free in the lobby but we needed to access wi-fi to use Skype to call home. Secondly, the Classic Double Room that we got was very small even for European standards. It was literally a room with a bed and not much else but the room was very clean. Thirdly, even though the hotel is non-smoking, there were guests in other rooms who were smoking and the air drifted into our room at night which was very unpleasant. There is a fine of 68 euros for smoking inside the hotel but we did not bother reporting it to the hotel attendant because we were too tired by the end of the night to do so. The hotel staff was very polite and helpful - not very warm and fuzzy but took care of anything we asked for, including hiring a car to drive us to the airport. Here is my advice for those considering this hotel: 1. Consider booking the rooms directly from the hotel's website rather than through another website. We found the hotel's rate to be at least 20 euros cheaper than others. 2. If you order a taxi through the hotel to drive you to the airport, there is a surcharge that applies for calling the taxi. When we got settled into our taxi, the meter was already at 9.50 euros because the meter starts when the taxi is called. There is a taxi stand nearby but we never saw any taxis waiting at the stand during our entire stay. 3. Take earplugs if you choose not to book a Superior Double Room. The Classic Double Rooms face the street or the courtyard (we got the courtyard facing room which was nice because it was super quiet) so if you get a room facing the street, the noise volume will be loud from the people on the street spilling out from the bars and restaurants. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to those who are looking for a centrally located hotel that is clean and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with charming staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: OaklandSandy
Reviews.Content: We stayed seven nights and enjoyed our stay immensely! The room sizes range from small to medium depending on the price. The rooms are very clean, comfortable, all are well appointed and some are very modern! The small street, Rue des Canettes, is a meeting place for conversation until the wee hours. So, if you desire silence, try to book well ahead and reserve a room that is not on the street side. Continental breakfast was great. In nice weather you can sit outside on an enclosed patio. The staff all speak English, they are knowledgeable and very willing to help. Nearby there are many bistros, bars, restaurants, a bakery, a pharmacy, ATM, metro and bus stations. Many tourist attractions are within walking distance. When we return, there is no doubt about where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and location make this hotel the best”
Reviews.Author: Tara60763
Reviews.Content: I feel so lucky to have stayed here of all places in Paris on my first trip to the City of Lights. With eateries, bars, and shopping steps away, and Notre Dame about a ten minute walk away, this hotel could not be situated any better. Staff were very kind--they held our bags when we arrived, called us cabs and served us lovely breakfasts and cocktails in the evening. The room was clean with cute little details like tiny wooden ducks in the bathroom because the street, Rue des Canettes, means "Duckling" Street. When I return to Paris, I will not look to stay anywhere else. It's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: sab444
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a gem. Its location is perfect; little walking streets full of great restaurants and shops. The staff couldn't be nicer, or more helpful. Rooms are very small, but that's the only negative. Breakfast was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love La Perle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GJKnox
Reviews.Content: We are experienced travelers and have just returned from Paris to Australia. We had five nights at La Perle and would definitely stay there again. The location was perfect surrounded by Cafes, Restaurants, and boutiques. The breakfast was delicious and a special mention is made of the wonderful service received from Lydia and Kocheida who work on reception. They went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating. Judith & George, Brisbane, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: Diggers74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel LaPerle in October and had a very enjoyable experience. The hotel is is small and quaint and rooms are clean and beds very comfortable. The hotel is surrounded by numerous excellent restaurants and is in walking distance to Norte Dame, Louxemburg Gardens, St Sulpice, and the Latin Quarter. I would strongly recommend this hotel as a place to nstay in Paris, no frills but great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RaeNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel La Perle for 4 nights. Our room faced the street on the first floor. Although there is a nightclub directly across the street, it's a very small place and we did not hear any noise. There are two sets of windows which block out all street noise. The staff is very friendly and efficient. They arranged for car service to the airport and made suggestions for our transportation from the airport upon our arrival in Paris. Breakfast was pleasant, and the service was excellent. It is a buffet but it's nice to have coffee/tea brought to the table promptly. Our room was typical of Paris but the bed was comfortable and we had a tub and separate water closet which was nice. The area can be busy but that worked to our advantage when we were too tired to venture far for dinner. There are many, many restaurants very close, including two creperies! There is endless shopping in the area as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel La Perle”
Reviews.Author: stouta
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful hotelâ€¦ My wife and I stayed at Hotel La Perle in October 2010. It is clean. The staff was courteous and very helpful, particularly since we spoke absolutely zero French. The location was great. There are a lot of shops, cafes, restaurants, and bars right around the hotel and itâ€™s only a ten to fifteen minute walk to Notre Dame or the Louvre. I would definitely recommend Hotel La Perle.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of hotel's taxi service”
Reviews.Author: SimRio
Reviews.Content: We had problems using the hotel taxi service. First time, the taxi came with the meter already with 17 euros, saying the traffic was all jammed The second time, going to the airport, the taxi said it would take 10 minutes to arrive. It took motre than half an hour. The meter was already with 15 euros, againg saying the traffic was jammed. It was not. And then after half an hour that seemd us that the driver was making an unwanted city tour, it stopped at a store to make a lotto game. We complained and he said he told us already that he was going to stop. (??????) The taxi service isn't reliable!!!

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: millerbjohn
Reviews.Content: Having visited Paris some 10 times, we have always stayed at different hotels, from two to four star, in various parts of the city. After our recent experience at Le Perle, we now have a permanent future hotel. The location is great, the rooms were very nice, the ambiance was pleasing, and the staff was exceptional beyond belief. What more can I say.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to be back at La Perle”
Reviews.Author: maxmagic1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many, many times at this great boutique hotel. I used to communte from the UK to Paris for about 6 months. At first I stayed at the big brand name 5 star hotels on the Right Bank in and around Bvd Haussman but then a French colleague recomended La Perle as a more tradiotional experience. After that I used La Perle as my base for about three months staying 3 or 4 days each week. I later rented an apartment not far away in the Latin Quarter. I returned to Paris over the Bastille Day holiday this year with my 22 year old daughter for a weekend. It is still a great mid range hotel. Staff are friendly and effecient. For non-Frecnh speakers their English is excellent. Amine is always smiling and helpful. The Hotel is in a wonderful ancient street, Rue Des Cannettes (Duckling street) in the 6th arrrondisment on the left bank. Just round the corner from the St Suplice Church made more famous in the Da Vinci Code. The immedaite area is full of bars, restaurants and cafes as well as some of the best fashion boutiques in Paris. In the afternoon I always had a glass of Sancerre Rose at Les Deux Magots a favourite haunt of Hemingway and JP Satre. Great palce to watch the world go by. My daughter and I comfortably walked to the river and to Notre Dame. You get what you pay for in terms of facilities but you have all you need on a short visit. Breakfast is European style coffee rolls and cold meats plus juice. The dinning area is sunny and quaint. The beds are getting on a bit but still servicable with continental quilts. I have recomended this place to many of my friends and colleagues and feedback is good. A fun place to stay in the heart of old Paris.

Reviews.Title: “4 star experience at 3 star prices”
Reviews.Author: scottm1313
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel La Perle for 4 nights at the beginning of our France vacation and then 2 additional nights at the end. I travel extensively and cannot say enough good things about this hotel, its staff and the location. Every staff member speaks fluent english and they were very accomodating of every need from tracking lost luggage to suggesting restaurants and making reservations. The hotel is immaculently maintained and the bar and breakfast area while small are very comfortable. The hotel is located on a charming narrow street with more pedestrian traffic than automobiles. The location in the heart of St. Germaine allow you to walk to hundreds of bars, restaurants and retail shops as well as the river and all main attractions. The superior rooms are smaller than a typical US hotel but the executive rooms are very spacious if you need more room. The wifi worked perfectly in both rooms we stayed in and there is also one work station in the lobby for guest use. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone and will stay here again the next time I am in Paris. Scott Miller, Kalamazoo Michigan

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mustardboy1812
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 8 days in Paris at the Hotel La Perle. While the quality and amenities of the hotel are very good, it is the location and the staff that make this hotel an excellent choice. We had an executive room which was surprisingly roomy. The location is perfect. You can walk to Notre Dame, the Louvre, Jardin du Luxenbourg, the Seine, Musee D'Orsay and the beautiful Eglise St. Sulpice is literally steps from the hotel. The Boulevard St-Germain with all its wonderful cafes and shopping is a 5 minute walk. There are also several Metro/RER stations in easy walking distance for when you want to visit the sights beyond a walk such as Versailles and Montmartre. The streets around the hotel have a large number of restaurants and cafes including some really exceptional ones such as Boucherie Rouliere (just down the street) and Monteverde (just around the corner). The hotel staff is helpful, responsive and exceptionally friendly and treat you like a guest in their home rather than just someone who booked a hotel room. English is spoken by all in case your French is a bit rusty. Rue Des Canettes becomes something of a pedestrian mall at night because the cafes, bars and restaurants cannot by law allow smoking inside and everyone goes into the street to talk and smoke. Because the Rue is very narrow it can get loud at times on weekends. We found the sights and sounds of the nightly conversion to a pedestrian setting very appealing, but, If you require silence you may want to reserve a room overlooking the courtyard and not the street. The Hotel La Perle is a small, top-quality hotel right in the heart of the most beautiful arrondissement in Paris (St. Germain-des-Pres). We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Pammie65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at La Perle. It had been recomended to us by friends who visit Paris at least once a year and will not stay anywhere else. They even told us to ask for Room 54. Our expectations were met and exceeded. La Perle is situated in the heart of Saint Germaine de Pres surrounded by cafes, shopping, nightlife, etc. Short walk to the major sights including the beautiful Luxemborg Gardens. Our room was large by Paris standards for a 3-star hotel. The staff (expecially Teddy, Anya and Muriel) were just fabulous- knowledgeable, attentive, friendly, professional. It rained for most of our stay so we were not able to enjoy the outdoor courtyard which was just beautiful. La Perle has not become the only hotel we will stay in when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and even greater location.”
Reviews.Author: richardatlanta80
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to most major attractions and many good restautants.Very helpful staff and excellant English spoken by all.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, very clean, friendly and helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: drrobgarfinkel
Reviews.Content: Make sure you get a courtyard facing room, quaint hotel, great location, very Parisian feel to the neighborhhod. Most Americans are spoiled and expect European rooms to be the size of their backyard, but most European Hotel rooms are small. This place was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay of 3 nights at this great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 60763Peter
Reviews.Content: Room was of good size, attractive, very clean, and the bedding was excellent as they advertised (very important after a long day of sight-seeing!). Our room was on the courtyard side and was very quiet. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful; the location is excellent. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly Small Hotel With A Great Locations”
Reviews.Author: Hencat
Reviews.Content: First off, some of these negative reviews must be from folks expecting George V on a Holiday Inn budget. As Paris 3-star hotels go, La Perle is exceptional. Nice and friendly staff, cute bar, free internet station and outdoor patio in a can't be beat location in St Germain. I've been in 3 star places in Paris with none of these amenities, just a sleeping night clerk to greet me reluctantly when I want to re-enter the hotel.The street may be a tad noisy, but you can't hear it in your room (though the walls are a bit thin). Across the street is a very old and atmospheric bar with a cave downstairs and a neat private table niche on the street. You're 50 yards from St Sulpice, in the heart of the boutiques and two minutes by foot to the Metro. The classic rooms are small, as is typical in Paris. The superior rooms are more than adequate. Nothing in Paris is truly spacious in this price range. Breakfast inside or on the enclosed patio was very good. My wife loved La Perle and she is picky. She wants to stay here on all future trips. Excellent value and accommodations in the heart of the Left Bank.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, with friendly staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travellingDoc27
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I enjoyed our 6 night stay at this delightful hotel. All the staff was welcoming and extremely friendly and helpful. We had a large room, on the street side, but unlike some of the other reviewers, the double windows prevented any street noise from interfering with our sleep. The location was JUST SUPERB - only a few blocks from the Luxembourg gardens which is perfect for a morning or evening jog. In the other direction, the metro is 2 blocks away, and just beyond are restaurants and shops for all the ingredients needed for a perfect evening of dining out or take out for dinner in the room. My highest recommendation for this lovely little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great amenities, would go back!”
Reviews.Author: z311rules
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel La Perle for 3 nights in May. The location is EXCELLENT! About a 5-min walk to the nearest train station, plus very close to St. Sulpice as a landmark (if you get lost!). There are TONS of little cafes and restaurants right on the same and nearby streets, and in about a 5-min walk you are in the heart of the St. Germain area with tons going on. You can walk to the Louvre area in an easy 10 minutes. The hotel is very nice, and they offer free internet, free breakfast, and a social/happy hour in the evenings. This set our days up well for wandering the great city. There was an elevator so you don't have to carry your bags all the way up. The room was a little on the small side as was the bed (to US standards) and pretty hard (better than too soft though!). We didn't mind though, because we didn't spend much time there! The bathroom was good size, and the window in our room looked out onto the inner courtyard (we heard other rooms facing the street could get noisy at night - don't know if it's true but we faced inward. Could see the breakfast/lounge area below. The staff was helpful and professional. Although there are literally TONS of places to choose near the hotel and in all of Paris, I would HIGHLY recommend a few places right nearby: Cafe Rit du Clown is a really cute place that has EXCELLENT crepes (sweet kinds and savory kinds). O'Neill's is a brewery a few spots down from the hotel with GREAT staff - friendly and entertaining - and great beer too. We went there several times over 3 days. Santa Lucia has really good pizza. There is a street just before the hotel that goes perpendicular to it that is lined with bars and restaurants that are great. If you get beyond that street and into the St. Germain area, the Cafe de Flores is a great place for dinner. And for more expensive tastes, along along the Champs d'Elysees on the way to the Arch de Triomphe are cafes also. Definitely get what I called a "bag sandwich" - everyone during the day was walking around with sandwiches wrapped in a paper bag. YUM! AND DON'T FORGET GELATO! :) We were VERY happy with the location of our hotel, and with the hotel itself. We'd definitely go back...hopefully sooner than later! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff !”
Reviews.Author: ltravel4fun
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 6 days, on a solo trip. I found the hotel to be in a perfect location, easy walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Musee D'Orsay, Luxembourg Gardens and many other sites....The staff was great, and the room was adequate sized, for European standards. The staff made me feel welcomed and were very helpful in suggesting eateries, and getting taxi's. They have free interent access and my reservation came with a free breakfast, which included fresh fruit, home made pastries, fresh coffee and many more items..I would stay here again, and plan on it ! I can't say enough good things about this lovely hotel in the Latin Quarter !

Reviews.Title: “Finding the hidden pearl ( La Perle) in Paris”
Reviews.Author: trojans
Reviews.Content: My aunt and I celebrated two milestone birthdays (50 and 70 respectively) by spending 5 days in Paris. After scouring numerous travel books and websites, during the course of a year of preparation, we were greatly rewarded with a hidden pearl-- or shall I say La Perle. We wanted a small boutique type hotel not too far removed form attractions and sites, but still a bit isolated as to provide security with a "neighborhood atmosphere". La Perle was ideal. Our room was spacious (for a European hotel), clean and comfortable. The staff was a joy---so patient and graciously kind. We were in easy walking distance of the Lourve, numerous historical sites, the Luxembourg Gardens, many wonderful restaurants, fabulous shopping, all the while remaining in the shadow of the beautiful Saint Surplice church. La Perle will not devour your vacation budget as it is quite affordable--a 3 star hotel that should be a 4! Just know that the rooms on the street side can be a bit noisy especially during the World Cup as people like to gather at the neighboring restaurants and bars to celebrate. All in all La Perle made our trip a grand success.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luv_2_travel203
Reviews.Content: A charming little hotel minutes from St. Germaine des Pres. Yes, my standard room was tiny, the beds were pretty tiny too - but they were comfortable and the linens immaculate. Other rooms were larger. Certainly we didn't notice any noise from other rooms. The bathroom had a wonderful shower and lots of hot water. The bathroom was restocked daily with soap, tissue and clean towels. The continental breakfast is served in a charming courtyard room with fresh coffee and croissants at each table and a yummy little buffet with fresh buns, cold meat, cheese, cereal and fruit. The staff was wonderful, really helpful, fluent in English and always charming. We were well satisfied and certainly received excellent value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Dianne15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at this hotel in early June. I chose it based on an internet special rate, which included a free breakfast. The pros: If you want to be in the thick of things (high-end shopping and mediocre restaurants) then this is a good spot to be. Make sure you ask for a courtyard room, however, since the street is crowded and noisy. The staff are all fluent in English, very friendly and helpful The bar is very nice, and a good quiet spot to stop by for a cafe creme or glass of wine. The breakfast was self serve and offered plenty of options. The Cons: The standard rooms are ridiculously small- at least ours was. There was barely enough room to pass by the end of the bed and the wall. We could not unpack our suitcases because there was no place to put our belongings. Definitely the smallest hotel room I have ever seen in my life. The king size bed was two twins pushed together- each bed had its own sheets and bedding and there was always a big gap between the two- rather strange, and not acceptable considering the room rates. I would not return to this hotel again, since I prefer a quieter area and I think there are nicer hotels available in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall experience”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeHondo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights here for our 25th anniversary. We had a superior double and the room was decent sized for Europe. The bathroom was excellent and modern with an excellent shower. The staff was extremely friendly and bilingual. The continental breakfast was included and was of high quality. There was a free wine tasting at 5 PM nightly. The location of the hotel is great and the area is quite active at night. Previous notations are true about possible street noise which is not a factor on rooms not facing the street. I can't say anything really negative about the stay. The bed wasn't great perhaps. The wifi was free and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and cozy atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Wegard
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be a hidden gem. It's location is central, with only a few minutes to the nearest subway. Walking distance to some of Paris most known attractions including Notre Dame and the museum of Louvre. The atmosphere of the hotel is cozy, with a nice bar, helpful very-good-english-speaking staff, as well as the hotel's street itself with wonderful bars and small charming restaurants. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: or2me
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Paris and had a wonderful 7 day stay at La Perle. We requested a courtyard room based on other comments about the street noise and were glad we did. The street is always full of activity late at night. In fact when we departed for the airport at 4:30 AM one bar was still open and the customers were hanging out in the street. The hotel staff were very helpful to first time visitors - explaining the metro system, suggesting restaurants, arranging airport transportation, etc. The location was ideal - close to metro stops, many good restaurants, cafes, bakeries, cute shops, and not far from most of the major sites. The hotel provides free wifi. However the code seemed to change randomly and each computer in the room needed a separate code. This required a trip to the lobby, however the staff was extremely accommodating each time. The only minor complaint was the exhaust fan in the bathroom ran all the time. The noise was easily resolved by keeping the door closed. We will definitely return to Paris and stay at La Perle!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely St. Germaine area hotel”
Reviews.Author: CMercer7
Reviews.Content: Our hotel staff was exceptionally qualified to meet all our needs. They were ready with maps, bus routes and suggestions to maximize our time in Paris. Hotel La Perle is in a great area for walking and exploring Paris. Our rooms were comfortable and they served breakfast in a charming atrium garden in the center of the hotel. We will definitely stay at Hotel La Perle on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rtb_stl
Reviews.Content: Easy recommendation. Great location and very helpful staff! Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want and at a fair price.”
Reviews.Author: csullijack
Reviews.Content: Hotel La Perle is tucked in on a small scale street in Paris' Saint Germain district, only a block and a half from the Blvd Saint-Germain, and a short two-block walk to two Metro stations: Saint Germain des-Pres (line 10) and Mabillon (line 4), making it very convenient to get around. You'll also find conveniently located ATM's a block away. Many good restaurants (cafes, bistros) are nearby, and the hotel staff is happy to assist in making recommendations or reservations. Many of Paris' top attractions are within walking distance (see the hotel's web site for details). You don't have to give up anything for this conveniently located quiet hotel in the midst of all that Paris has to offer. The hotel itself is charming. A small lobby opens to a comfortable bar and beyond that, a glass covered dining area where a European breakfast is served to guests each morning--wonderful French rolls, butter, brie, thinly sliced ham and cheese, fresh fruit, milk, juice, yogurt, assorted cereals, and of course, cafe au lait and croissants. The dining area opens to an outdoor courtyard in good weather, but we were there during this spring's cool spell. The hotel is fully air conditioned, has elevators, modern bathrooms including hair dryers, room safes in each room. The rooms vary in size. Each floor has 7 rooms: 3 singles opening onto the courtyard, 2 doubles above the street side, and 2 larger doubles/king overlooking the courtyard along the side. We had one of these, Room #11. It was small, as all european hotel rooms seem to traveling Americans, but more than adequate. There was ample storage for our week's worth of clothes (shelves and hanging space in the closet), and we were able to stow our rollaboards above the closet. The bed was a double single (basically two twin beds pushed together into a king size. It was made up as two separate beds, with lovely duvet's in fresh percale duvet covers on each side. TV and telephone in room, and you will be provided with the password for their "Meteor" wifi when you check in. If you don't bring your own computer or internet capable phone, the hotel has a computer and printer available to guests in an alcove near the breakfast area. All of the staff were friendly, capable, and fluent in English. We paid 182 euros per night, which included breakfast each morning (typically valued at 13 euros per person). Drinks ordered at the hotel bar were fairly priced (less than in cafes and brasseries). A great spot!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Great value”
Reviews.Author: Gregor45
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel La Perle. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The location was perfect for walking and also for access to the Metro. We enjoyed the restaurants around the area and the breakfast included at the hotel. Very convenient and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay on the rive gauche: comfortable, convenient, good value”
Reviews.Author: dgbh
Reviews.Content: Lovely stay. Our upgrade request was not received, and we declined the first room. Second room was better, very small -- but quiet, clean and tidy. Beds not terribly comfortable, but top quality linens! Rooms are quiet on the courtyard side of the hotel -- avoid the front facing rooms as very lively bars and restaurants line the (side) street of this very hopping left bank neighborhood. Very convenient location, just two short blocks from the St Germain metro station. Great restaurants and chic stores in the neighborhood too. Simple continental breakfast is included -- with typical french breads, coffee, fresh oj, yogurts, cheese and fruit -- perfect to start off the morning as neighborhood cafes are quite pricey in Paris. Free Wifi!

Reviews.Title: “La Perle, a pearl of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: johndgbr
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Paris on business with my wife and arrived Sunday 11th April and stayed in the Novotel Tour Eiffel, a pleasant enough hotel but on the outer reaches of the city. So when the volcano struck on the Thursday and it became apparent we would not be going anywhere soon I decided to treat my wife to a few extra days in Paris and moved from my original hotel to La Perle where I'd stayed on a previous business trip. The few extra days turned out to 6 extra days. We could not have wished for a better place to wait out the"fallout", forgive the pun. This hotel is one of the best hotels I have stayed in in Paris, and I've stayed in a few. It's not the cheapest but it is not the most expensive. The hotel is situated slap bang in the middle of St Germain with a myriad of restautants and cafes quite literally on the doorstep. For the ladies there is an enormous array of shopping possibilities, from the local boutique shops in the small streets of St Germain to Le Bon Marche, the very upmarket shopping centre no more than 10 minutes stroll away. The hotel itself is tucked away on Rue de Canettes, a very narrow street with St Sulpice at the bottom. Once trhough the doors you will be surprised at the spaciousness of the hotel and the very warm and friendly greeting, in English, in fact one of the guys on the desk is from Glasgow. The rooms are very comfortable....if you want to swing a cat you'll probably have to go to a more expensive and less well located hotel. But if you are happy with bright, cosy and quiet then you are fine. I could go on with the superlatives but in short this is one of the best hotels I've stayed in and during the recent "siege" the staff could not have been more helpful, understanding and flexible. I can thoroughly reccommend this hotel.....we will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: enna17
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 5 nights here. You can not get a better location. We walked everywhere. The Louvre and Norte Dame are very close. The restaurants in the neighborhood are the best. We never had to venture too far to find a great meal. The only complaint I had was we were on the street side and there is a lot of action outside on Friday and Saturday night and you can hear it all. The other nights were fine but I would ask for a room on the courtyard side. The staff was excellent, the breakfast was basic, rolls, croissants, fruit, etc but perfect. We loved every part of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!!”
Reviews.Author: RonMilton_Ma
Reviews.Content: Hidden gem! Great location and wonderful helpful staff. Stayed for 3 nights with my daughter. Easy access to everywhere in Paris and neighborhood has great atmosphere, shopping and food. Rooms on small side but comfortable and quiet (stayed on the courtyard side).

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SD_MandJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 6 nights over the New Year season and we couldn't have asked for a better location. This hotel is about 3 blocks from the closest metro and has at least eight fantastic restaurants nearby. The area is trendy and fun, perfect for what we were looking for, where the locals hang out. We had a room facing the courtyard so it was super quiet at night. The hotel is a non-smoking hotel (which is very rare in Paris) and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The only negative thing I could say about this place was that the room we had was extremely small. The bathroom was decent with a tub/shower and good-sized sink space. We got used to the size of the room and didn't mind at all after the first day. Oh yeah, the hotel also had free Wi-Fi!! Perfect if you're traveling with a laptop of smartphone. If location is what you are looking for, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: cahema
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel La Perle for New Year's Eve. We were so pleased that we had chosen to spend our time at Hotel La Perle. The service was excellent (best we've ever had in Paris), the complimentary breakfast delicious, and our rooms clean. Best, it is situated on a beautiful, quiet picturesque street close to the Metro and trendy St. Germaine district. The concierge recommended an excellent neighborhood restaurant where I had the best mutton I've ever had in my life. Definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff and location”
Reviews.Author: pabrinkman
Reviews.Content: What can I say? I'll never stay anywhere else in Paris. The staff was helpful, kind and entertaining and the locationâ€“tres bon! It is far enough away from the touristy Latin Quarter, yet within a short walk of most sites and attractions. We were upgraded to the best room in the house (maybe because I was wearing and suit and my wife was dressed to kill). My only complaints: (1) the furniture and carpet are a little tired, though the bathroom was amazing, and (2) there was a lot of "pipe" noise in the room. I also could here someone through the HVAC venting discussing the need to get a new toothbrush. Don't let any of that turn you off to this wonderful place, though.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Laura_I_W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights in November and it was absolutely perfect for us. So clean and comfortable, and the staff is amazing. We stayed in room 28, facing the street. If quiet is important to you at night, it would be wise to request a room facing the courtyard instead. But the neighborhood itself was wonderful - home to some of the best bakeries in Paris - and major subways right around. And the breakfast at the hotel - included in the rate - was excellent, and served in a beautiful windowed patio room. Most importantly, it was such a pleasure to come home from a long day and relax in the clean, comfortable rooms and soft beds!

Reviews.Title: “beware - room 01”
Reviews.Author: denhunt58
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to trip to Paris was our third stay at this hotel. Our previous two visits to this hotel were in rooms facing out onto the street below. The street is very busy with more pedestrians than traffic ( a very narrow one-way street); and at night becomes even more busy when the many bars and restaurants/bistros open their doors. The very early morning street cleaners, and refuse collections/delivery vans make sure that you wake very early, and if you have been kept awake for most of the night with the revellers, then this does not make for a welcome wake-up call. Our recent visit, however, was in room 01; a ground floor (the only ground floor bedroom) superior room. At first we thought "great" - a good peaceful night's sleep, in a good-sized (by Parisienne standards) room. The decor was ok - although could do with a spruce up. Being on the groundfloor, the room had french doors opening out onto the decking area which is open to all guests (their entrance to the decking area would be via the breakfast room (conservatory). Unlike any of the other rooms (and indeed uncommon with most hotel rooms) our room had a bathroom window ( a rather large, frosted glass window). We assured ourselves that the window would be non-see through given it's frosting. Oh dear how wrong could we be!! At breakfast the first morning, we were seated facing the conservatory windows, looking out onto the decking, and onto our room's french doors, and the bathroom window. To our shock and horror, we had left the bathroom light on, and every little detail was visible to everyone in the breakfast room. The next most troubling issue we had with room, is that all the rooms above ours seemed to have their toilet pipes going through our room, behind a boxed area on the wall. Each time a toilet was flushed, we were awoken throughout the night (6 floors with at least 2 rooms per floor made for many toilet flushes!! There was also a low rumbling until the early hours; we discovered this was the metro running beneath the hotel (obviously we had not noticed this on our previous visits being on the higher floors). Another point about room 01 is quite a sensitive issue - if you are planning on having a typical romantic break in the city of 'love', then do not have room 01. The room is equipped for disabled guests (a walk-in shower; a commode in the bathroom; and 2 single beds pushed together but certainly not a double bed - the gap in between makes it impossible to get close to close to your sleeping partner!), and the beds have buttons to raise and lower the head/foot to make it easier to get our of the bed. All of these issues make the room very unromantic and a total turn-off - so something to be aware of, or indeed beware off. We emailed ahead and asked for the hotel to arrange an airport collection for us. This cost 90 euros (CDG to hotel in a VW people carrier). We got a taxi back to CDG at the end of our stay, cost was 61 euros ( a Mercedes people carrier). So you would better off booking a taxi. The staff were ok - I would say they were no friendlier than a shop assistant in the many shops we visited; and certainly could have been more hospitable given their profession. Breakfast on the Sunday was very busy, and I would say that the hotel is a stop-off for many french people who come to the city for shopping/entertainment at the weekend. However, they sit at the very few breakfast tables, reading their newspapers, whilst other guests have to wait for a table to have breakfast. We wanted a longer stay in Paris than just a couple of days, so chose this hotel over our absolute favourite, but very expensive, Hotel de Crillon. The entire stay at Hotel le Perle would have one night at the de Crillon. But in future, we will stay fewer nights in Paris and enjoy the luxury and attention to every detail, and absolute perfection of the de Crillon, rather than subject ourselves to many nights of no or broken sleep in a room that would be better off in a hospital. One last thing - the shower lacks power and is very difficult to wash hair in (especially if you have longer hair), it is no more than trickle. If you do get this room, try putting up bath towels around the bathroom window to give you privacy and not be the hotel entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tricolor00
Reviews.Content: Excelent location. Staff also excelent. Some rooms are small. Excelente breakfast. Very good acess to Internet. Charming.

Reviews.Title: “It is a lovely hotel perfectly located for everything on right and left banks”
Reviews.Author: Dtor
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights and was completely surprised on the size of room. It was very comfortable with french windows opening onto the inside courtyard and very quiet. The lobby. bar area , breadfast and courtyard all all spacious and inviting with breakfast that had fresh crolissants, meats cheeses , juice etc. The staff were very friendly, and accomodatin looking up several places for me to attend and helping with tickets. All spoke good English. The area is a little gem with hopping restaurants and bars or stroll through the Luxemburgh garden as I did every morning. Perfectly located, easy access to the metro. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Supberb hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: mbartinsights
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Paris for the Nuit Blanche celebration and stayed at La Perle for a week. Very friendly and helpful staff, and a comfortable, quiet room. The dining area/sunroom was lovely for breakfast every morning. Great location for getting around the city. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be nicer”
Reviews.Author: ridgegal
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 6 nights at Hotel La Perle in the St. Germaine district and couldn't have been more pleased. The staff (including Arine) was excellent. Anything we needed or wanted they were more than willing to help with patience and grace. The breakfasts were very good to begin the day, the room was a little small but very clean and bright. The concierge went out of her way to confirm tours, taxis and directions. The bar man at night provided coffee and drinks with a smile and conversation. Very satisfied with our experience at Hotel La Perle.

Reviews.Title: “Service was above and beyond, friendly, slept well, ate well and enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: ladyfromcalifornia
Reviews.Content: We found the hospitality very good, reception friendly and helpful....we came in late and were starving. The hotel staff made us sandwiches from his dinner for free, the manager was incredibly friendly and helpful, let us stay longer as we had a late train (and there happened to be extra room). Our room was nice and we slept so well. The area was well situated, making a comfortable, quick walk to Luxemburg Gardens, Latin Quarters, great shops, and not far the other direction, the Louvre and river. Internet service was free! We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential charming small Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeanQuebecois
Reviews.Content: I just returned from spending a week (August 2009) at Hotel La Perle, as the leader of a group of 11 other travelers. The hotel is in the St.-Germain district, one of the best areas in Paris for a tourist visit: 4 metro stations within easy walking distance, great historical/cultural tourist attractions within a 20-minute walk in any direction, a very quiet side street but only steps from bustling and historic Boulevard Saint-Germain and the Latin Quarter. Wonderful cafes in all directions, narrow winding streets, shops, etc. Everything was absolutely clean, the rooms a bit small by American standards but roomy by Parisian standards, very comfortable bed, mini-bar, private bath, safe, work table, 110/220 plug in bathroom for American appliances. Free internet even, but French key board takes a little adjustment. Charming breakfast area, excellent breakfast, spotless cheerful reception area. All staff were extremely helpful, courteous and attentive and spoke good English. And can I praise Anya at the front desk enough? A very intelligent young Russian woman, flawless French and English, doctorate student, who handled everything perfectly, promptly, and went beyond what was needed. She is a tremendous asset to this hotel. As someone who has traveled all over the world in 42 countries and stayed at hotels from tiny holes to big luxury hotels, I was very pleased with everthing about this hotel, as was everyone else in my group, and I will definitely book there again on a return visit. This is being in Paris. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and clean!”
Reviews.Author: infrequentraveler39
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel La Perle for one week with mother (age 81) and daughter (age 17) and this was a perfect spot for us for several reasons. Extremely well located so in the evening when we were tired it was easy to walk to a variety of restaurants. Rooms while on the small side were exceptionally clean and quiet. Lovely to open windows onto inner courtyard. Concierge or front desk attendee Anya solicitious and very very helpful in a friendly warm way . My one suggestion to hotel is that they have more than one Anya at front desk. Other "concierge" types okay but lacked the interest and enthusiasm of Anya. She offered suggestions and helped us navigate the city in a way that others did not. Coffee excellent at breakfast and access to computer in lobby helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stayl”
Reviews.Author: Terry091
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to recommend it.The service was friendly and courteous beyond the norm,the location is great,being a few steps away from Boulevard St Germain and surrounded by numerous restaurants.The rooms are full of character and the facilities just great.We will always stay there on future trips to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - good location, clean, big room”
Reviews.Author: spozsik
Reviews.Content: Very good location in a quiet area, still near to Metro lines and few minutes walk to city main attractions and to Jardin de Luxembourg. The staff was friendly and the room was nice, big and clean. We would have apreciated a little more natural light and a bigger choice at breakfast. Overall we felt very comfortable and were satisfied by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean hotel, newly renovated, great service.”
Reviews.Author: bbcp
Reviews.Content: Went with my wife and 2 teenagers, who stayed in a separate room. Highly convenient, newly renovated. Room size and bathroom facilities are excellent for Europe. Very helpful front desk, they all spoke English. Nice quiet atrium area in back if you don't like the cafe scene. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “warm smiles, professional service, unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: dcmdvawanderer
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel after reading the Tripadvisor writeups and could not have been happier. I followed the advice about getting a room on the back courtyard and had a very quiet room. The narrow street in front is charming and filled with restaurants and bars that are busy late. The rooms are relatively small and simply furnished, but mine had exposed beams ( the hotel is in a 17th century building). The bathroom was adequately sized with good water pressure and plenty of hot water. The cold breakfast of breads, fruit, meat and cheese was included in my rate and was a good way to start the day in the pleasant breakfast area. But the real reasons to stay here are the location and the people. The hotel is smack in the middle of St. Germain, but on a narrow low traffic street. Most of central Paris is within a 20-25 minute walk, several famous cafes (de Flore, Deux Magots) are a few blocks away as is the Luxembourg Gardens. Two metro lines are a five minute walk. The staff of the hotel offered the best combination of warnth and professionalism I have seen. Ask about the neighborhood restaurants, of which there are many. The small in-house bar is hidden treasure, a quiet retreat after a long day with an excellent bartender.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: susangail
Reviews.Content: There were no surprises based on all the previous reviews. The room was small based on European rooms not unusual. Price great, rooms clean, staff friendly and helpful. Free internet use and extensive continental breakfast-croisants, cereal, juice, milk, tea , coffe and more. If you are looking to stay where you can walk to the Seine or many of the attractions and lots of great cafes this is the place. Metro also very close. If you get a chance to go to the little sandwich shop one block down great salads. I wish I was back there already. Do ask for a courtyard room. Also has elevator and hairdryers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Gem inbetween St. Sulpice and St. Germain.”
Reviews.Author: ChucknMichele
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. Nice rooms. Descent breakfast. My family and I stayed for six days in Hotel La Perle and loved it. Right in the middle of it all. What we didn't walk to, the two Metro stops within two blocks easily got us there.

Reviews.Title: “This is a 4* for 3* price...great value”
Reviews.Author: AnneToine
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 6:30 AM on a Sunday morning and were greeted with big grins and a most accomodating attitude. Having just arrived from Toronto (on an Air France Airbus) we were jet lagged and tired. The staff were great. Within minuets the Night Manager organized coffee, some breakfast (it normally starts at 7:00AM) and a secure place to store our luggage while we waited for our rooms to be made up. Subsequently they arranged cabs, restraunts and directions to varrious venues. located in the heart of the entertainment district, St. Germain, its close to everything. Recently renovated rooms were great. No wifi but free computer in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel, great service and location, clean room”
Reviews.Author: benlina
Reviews.Content: The La Perle hotel exceeded our expectations, due to the extremely friendly and professional staff. Our room (# 11) on the first floor overlooked the courtyard, which meant traffic noise was minimal.Continental breakfast was very nice. The hotel is located close to 3 metro stops, and major attractions were within walking distance. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: BondGirlinJAX
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel from reviews on tripadvisor. Loved it! Great location in Saint-Germain and just a few minutes walk from the Saint-Germain metro stop (not a problem with luggage either). Staff is VERY friendly and appears to cater to an english speaking clientele. Breakfast in the morning is cheese, ham, turkey and fresh fruit. Plus cereal, croissants, coffee, juice...YUM! Rooms are (like everyone says) clean but small compared to American standards. Bar across the street is loud at night so request a room overlooking the courtyard not the street if you are a light sleeper. We would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: pktraveler09
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and based on the previous reviews in TripAdvisor we opted to stay at Hotel La Perle for 3 nights. We were not disappointed. The hotel is located on a quiet street near St. Sulpice, with shopping and many cafes nearby. Because of its central location we opted to walk to all the tourist sights, even though the hotel is close to Metro stops. The staff were very friendly, helpful and conversed well in English. Breakfast, served every morning in the garden area, consisted of rolls, cold cuts and fruit salad. Our room was comfortable and quiet. We would definitely come back here again and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend Hotel La Perle - Location, Accomodation, Staff - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: PassportWanderer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Paris on our 10 year anniversary trip â€“ excellent vacation by all accounts. The Hotel La Perle was our first Hotel that we stayed at on our 10 day trip. Hindsight, I would have stayed there the whole time. The entire staff was wonderful! Front desk was extremely helpful, welcomed us warmly, and were always a pleasure at all hours of the day. From assisting with taxis, mailing international postcards, to ensuring all of requests were carried out to the tee. The morning breakfast was a great start to our daily adventures and was included in the room price. The location was excellent. It is nicely situated in a lively neighborhood. Our room had double set of windows to keep out any nightly noises that others had commented about, but it was always fairly tame and never was an issue for us. We need to also mention the Italian restaurant immediately across the street and to the right of the hotel â€“ the food was wonderful and fairly priced. Very nice people indeed. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Left Bank quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelOSeas
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at this hotel. The hotel is very central to all Left Bank sights plus it is easily accessible to all of Paris with the metro stations closeby. It is located in a very quiet laneway which is essential for a quiet night's sleep. The hotel room was very clean with very comfortable beds and a modern, clean bathroom, that was a decent size. It has all you need, except an iron (however you can use their laundry room). The doonas were quite hot for summer though! As other's say the room is small by Australian/American standards but as everybody says, you're never in it except to sleep, so as long as you have hot water, a comfortable bed and airconditioning to come back to, with the assurance of cleanliness, what more do you need. Hotel breakfast room was airy and bright and a lovely place to plan your day. Breakfast was continental style and delicious, probably pricier than outside the hotel but you just do what suits you at the time. We didn't eat there every morning. There were also wonderful creperies located in the same street as well as various restaurants/cafes nearby. While I think of it, there were also wonderful shops nearby. Just walk around and explore - it's very rewarding. I would easily stay there again, but only if the price was not too extreme, as it can be pricey at certain times of the year. When I went (post Bastille Day,July 2007) it was low season. As an extra note, we felt safe travelling around Paris at all times, whether it was morning, evening around the main sights or even midnight up at the Trocadero watching the Tower lit up. We used metro everywhere and at anytime. The metro is very easy to use. Buy 'une carnet' of tickets at a time (ie 10 tickets) as it's cheaper than buying 10 individually. Don't even consider buying daily/combo tourist passes as they're more expensive. Also if you're sightseeing you definately need to buy a museum pass (3, 4 and 7 day passes from memory) They are well worth the money. I've only been to Paris twice, but bought them both times (I think I bought 4 day passes each time). Bonus is Children are free for enty to most musems until they are 18! Also you don't have to queue up in the long lines, you go to special entrances. One final recommendation is to buy the Rick Steve's guidebook for Paris or anywhere. They tell you all you need to know. I wont even try to explain, but my sisters and I always buy them for all our travels. We must own most of his European city and country books! And by the way, while we think they're written for inexperienced travellers and mainly an American market, they have a wealth of hand's on information. We're Australian and travel every second year to Europe; we feel other books don't come close.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: delta004
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are a good size, is clean and there is a good sized bathroom with a bathtub. There is also a minibar and room safe but no kettle for tea or coffee. The location is fantastic and there are many restaurants, cafes and bars nearby. You can also easily walk to many of the sights or just go to the nearest metro station which is only a minute away. The staff are very friendly and helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris - an excellent experience.”
Reviews.Author: reticulate
Reviews.Content: Excellent location/price balance. 5 minutes away from a subway stop, 10-15 minute walking or short subway ride to top tourist sites. Neighboring streets are packed with cafes, restaurants and shops. Friendly, professional front desk staff - all of them spoke very good English and were keen to help.
