The rooms are small and somewhat spartan, but clean and fully functional (TV, A/C, full bathroom). Perfectly adequate breakfast in the hotel restaurant (was included in our rate).

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience for our first visit to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: SnikSnack
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel for us. Me, my husband and our 9-year old son were very comfortable/cozy in our room. The beds/linens were clean and inviting, the bathroom was also spotless. Our room was a bit warm, but we slept with the window open each night and enjoyed the cool night air...we did not hear any noise from the street as our room opened over the courtyard in the back. I needed to see a doctor during our stay and the two gentlemen at the front desk arranged for an English speaking doctor to come to the hotel to see me. The doctor arrived within 30 minutes! Now that's great service! We enjoyed the breakfast every morning and there were plenty of restaurants to choose from within a few blocks for dinner. We would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to our family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MSUWSU
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was delightful. We enjoyed staying on the Left Bank for the first time. The service at the hotel was marvelous. The entire staff was friendly, gracious and helpful. The restaurant recommendations were terrific. The rooms were small, but we expect this at Paris hotels and were not expecting American size rooms. When in Paris we don't spend any time in our hotel room. The bathroom was sparkling. The breakfast room was pleasant and airy and we enjoyed the food very much. The hotel is located on a narrow street with several restaurants and pubs. The young people of Paris do like to party, so if you need a quiet spot this charming hotel may not be for you. We were not bothered by the noise but others might be.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel La Perle is a gem”
Reviews.Author: artteach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at La Perle from Mar. 17- 20th with a school group. The hotel staff was very accomodating. They changed rooms for the boys who did not have seperate beds, provided extra towels ,provided a book with maps of Paris for us to walk around with and were very friendly to our group. The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable,the towels extraordinarily large and absorbent- not those thin , rough and tiny towels you find in most places and the hotel areas -rooms were very clean. The closets provided a great deal of space for hanging things or shelves for storing sweaters. The showers were hot , good water pressure and a shower curtain was a pleasure instead of those half glass shower walls. The breakfast was very good- excellent fresh squeezed orange juice brought to your table and lovely fresh tea served in a teapot with a strainer for tea leaves along with fresh croissants, brioche,ham cheese, fruit, yogurt, etc. .Fresh flowers adorn the tables. Hotel Location- close to Luxembourg gardens and the Mabillon metro in the Latin Quarter. The only negative is there is a bar directly across the street which attracts customers to congregrate on the street at night where this hotel is located. You can overlook it with all the plusses and this pearl is a gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dane132008
Reviews.Content: This clean hotel had all the amenities we required. Great location near the Metro and Louve and nice restaurants. The english speaking staff was very friendly and helpful. We recommend this hotel and hope to visit there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers91
Reviews.Content: This is a great Paris hotel, in a great location. Although its a little small its very clean and the staff on the front desk are lovely. Breakfast is a little light on, so don't expect anything hot. However it's just what you need to get started in the morning. The rooms are small, but again, very clean and that's all you need for a shopping weekend in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat this location”
Reviews.Author: CAVoyage
Reviews.Content: We go to Paris fairly often (I'm French) and have tried multiple hotels in Paris. This was the second time we stayed at La Perle. This hotel has a fantastic location in St Germain. There are lots of great restaurants and bars in the street where the hotel is located and the surrounding streets. There are three metro stations really close by and the hotel is also at walking distance from the Jardin du Luxembourg, rue de Rennes and Notre Dame. The room was of a good size by Paris standard. The room was very clean, the bed very good and so was the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: raudinot
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the La Perle hotel in October 2008. My first impression of the hotel was "wow what a fantastic location" ! The hotel is located in the beautiful and lively St. Germain district and I could not have asked for a better location. The area was full of outstanding restaurants and quaint coffee bars. The metro was a 5 minute walk which will take you to any part of Paris. Our room was spacious and provided us with everything we could ask for. It overlooked a courtyard and was very quiet at night. The front desk personnel were extremely friendly, helpful, and attended to all of our needs. I recommend this hotel highly and will stay there again on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Hotel La Perle”
Reviews.Author: kileygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in a standard room. The room was very small (as expected) but the bathroom was a good size compared with the small room. Positives about the hotel: - Great location! Very convenient to two metro lines (5 minute walk or less). Plenty of cafes, shops, etc. located nearby. Short walk to nearby churches (St. Germain des Pres and St. Sulpice) and Luxembourg Park. And most of the great Paris chocolate shops are in this neighborhood. - Hotel Staff- English-speaking, helpful with directions, calling for taxis, etc. Housekeeping staff did a good job with keeping our room clean, towels stocked, etc. - Good breakfast selection- nice selection of bread, yogurt, fruit, etc. Spacious breakfast area with outdoor seating when the weather is nice. - Quiet room (we had courtyard view). Plenty of hangers. - Bathroom- clean with good water pressure, clothesline, tub and shower. - Locked storage area for luggage- we were very surprised that almost every other hotel we stayed at in Europe did not have a locked area for us to store our luggage before check-in/after check-out. Negatives about the hotel: - Our room wasn't ready at the stated check-in time. This was annoying because we had arrived in Paris at 9am after an overnight flight and really wanted to freshen up. The public bathroom in the hotel is very small, down on the bottom floor, not great when you need to freshen up and can't get into your room. Overall, we would stay here again but would pay for a bigger room. There wasn't enough space for both of us to be walking in the room at the same time. I chose this hotel for it's location and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: fforster3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hotel La Perle for a fantastic weekend in Paris. Firstly, the hotel is located on a beautiful side street in what turned out to be a beautiful area of Paris, St Germaine des Pres. Across the street from the hotel was a little bar, called Chez george, that overflowed onto the street on Saturday night and provided the perfect Parisian experience for both of us. Close to the hotel are an array of small, intimate restaurants and bars that were easy on the pocket too. There was alot to see within walking distance of the hotel. The hotel itself is very clean and tidy, we asked for a courtyard room, based on previous reviews and the room overlooked a very quiet courtyard. The room was indeed small but it was only somewhere we threw the bags. Breakfast was just a simple cold meat platter and bread, but it was nice. The staff were very helpful, and recommended nice restaurants etc. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Small & Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pacific_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only 2 nights in this lovely little hotel. The location is excellent for shopping, restaurants, sight seeing, free internet & even doing one's laundry! We had been travelling for over 4 weeks by the time we arrived here & it was great to have a laundromat so close by. We had a room on the 5th floor that overlooked the street. It wasn't large, but it had a bath and it was very clean & comfortable. It was great value for Paris. The cupboard & wardrobe space is a bit limited but if you're only here for a few nights, it doesn't really matter. We found the staff very friendly & helpful & the breakfast more than adequate. It's also an easy walk to the Seine by the Rue Bonaparte. Henri's restaurant is excellent around the corner! We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CT143
Reviews.Content: A great small hotel located in the 6th district. It is in walking distance of all major sites. We had a room on the 5th floor facing the street and it was very quiet. Room was small and comfortable and very clean. It had a large modern tub and shower bathroom. Staff was very helpful. Places to eat are nearby along with a super chocolate shop by the name of Pierre Herme at 72 Rue Bonparte.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuruToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Perle for 4 nights in July. Great location (if you're looking for something quiet ask for a garden facing room or stay somewhere else) the street view rooms were pretty loud as the street fills with club goers till the early morning hours, however, clean rooms (yes, small but it is Europe) very helpful staff (particularily a blond lady who speaks very good french and english but is swedish) and the location is superb! Hotel bar closes aruond midnight (kind of sucks) but there are plenty of bars in the area. The bed was VERY comfortable and the mattress and sheet VERY clean. Overall for the rate we paid - EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Paris Comfort”
Reviews.Author: EthelM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel La Perle for 4 nights in early July and I loved it. The location is great and is near the Metro, a pharmacie, and a Monoprix (think Target/grocery store). Rue des Canettes is full of restaurants and shops. The Pizzeria Positano is literally 10 steps from the hotel and has excellent pasta. I was travelling alone (female) and always felt safe in the location. The room was small, plain, clean, and quiet. It overlooked the back courtyard. The street becomes packed with people at night, but I never heard noise from my room. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom had a shower/tub combo with a shower curtain. The breakfast offering was yogurt, fruit, croissants & bread, juice, coffee (made to order), and some meat and cheese. Perfect to start the day. The staff was always helpful and arranged a taxi for me to the airport with no problem. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leroy_Melb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel for two nights after the Tour de France. It is close to all major attractions and within walking distance of the Louvre and attractions close to that. The rooms are quite nice, breakfast area is great (and the service was great), and the Bar area is excellent for a relaxed drink. If you ask at the Desk you can get a voucher for free WIFI internet access that lasts for 24 hours. When that runs out ask for another. Overall very happy with this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “La Perle Is A " Gem "”
Reviews.Author: dbelsher
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Hotel La Perle and enjoyed a wonderful experience. It has a great location within walking distance of most major attractions. The hotel is clean, bright, and cheerful with a great breakfast room, and comfortable bar area to enjoy a nightcap in the evening. The rooms are small by our North American standards, but better than we expected for Europe. The best part of our stay was the treatment we received from the staff, particularly Lydia & Sofia at the front desk, and Royce the bar manager. We would recommend the hotel to anyone travelling to Paris. Don & Marilyn Belsher Priddis, Alberta Canada

Reviews.Title: “Will return to Hotel La Perle”
Reviews.Author: Monroe1Monroe1
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Hotel La Perle and overall it was a good experience. The location is wonderful, the staff very accommodating and the hotel is very clean. Our room was small and on the street. It is true the noise on the front of the hotel will wake you from sleep but we asked to be moved and were moved quickly. The rooms on the courtyard are 100% quieter. The person at the desk was very apolegetic. The hotel is so close to great restaurants, a good market and the metro. It will be my choice when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: luckygirl39
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice, clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff. Located right around the corner from really great toy soldier (lead) store, Au Plat d'etain on Rue Guisarte. Walking distance to most everything a tourist wants to do.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: milliemurfitt
Reviews.Content: We came across La Perle back in 2005 on a whirlwind trip to Paris, we decided it was time to go back and had no hesitation in rebooking la perle as we had good memories from last time. However the experience we had was very different. We arrived to find the receptionist more interested in talking to the cleaner. Once we had got her attention she was very brisk with us and told us we had to wait 10 minutes. Once we got our keys and opened the door to our room we were extremely disappointed to find we had been put at the back of the hotel in a very small dark room that was not at all inviting or expected for the 170 euro cost. We immediately went down stairs to complain about the room and asked if we could be moved, we could not have one of the front rooms like last time as they were all full, therefore we took an upgrade to the only other available room at an extra 50 euros per night. It made the room very expensive however it was a big improvement. When I booked it originally online I was told it did not include breakfast however when we checked out the same very stern receptionist asked if we had had breakfast as it was included. We felt frustrated that she hadn't bothered to tell us when we checked in. The experience was one we would not recommend, there are loads of good hotels in the area, would advise leaving La Perle until they can give better customer service to it's guests.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Location but small room"”
Reviews.Author: telecomchick
Reviews.Content: We just retuned from a 3 week trip to France. We ended our trip at the Hotel La Perle. We loved the location it could not be better it was right near Luxembourg Gardens, St Germain and just around the corner from St Sulplice. The room was very small and we had a lot of luggage so it was tight. From other reviews, it sounds like you can get a larger room. We tried but the hotel was booked and could not upgrade us. However, the staff was very accommodating. The breakfast was your standard fare nothing fancy. For the price, I think it was a good deal considering how much rooms cost in Paris and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip”
Reviews.Author: Jenny026
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 fabulous days in Paris and the hotel met every expectation we had. It was incredibly easy to find, just a very short walk from the St Germain metro stop and the staff on reception were incredibly friendly and helpful on arrival and throughout the whole stay. The room was perfect, we specified a superior bedroom overlooking the courtyard and not the street as we read reviews this kind of bedroom could be noisy. We had very comfortable restful nights! The room was a good size, bathroom was fairly modern and were cleaned very quickly and efficiently everyday. Breakfast was basic but sufficient and we often sat in the bar area in the evening before or after dinner as it was very peaceful and relaxing in the conservatory area. It is a fantastic location for a hotel as it is situated in a very upmarket area with many designer shops a stones throw away and many tourist attractions are within a reasonable walk. Restaurants are very good in the vicinity, particularly the italian directly opposite the hotel. We loved everything about our stay from start to finish and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of having a relaxing break.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fun_travel_toronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered the best value for our money on our recent trips to Europe. Nice rooms, airconditioning that really worked! Best of all were the staff. Very helpful and always ready with advice. I highly recommend the hotel to any traveler. The area around the hotel is a lot of fun and offers an excellent experience of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: debi.in.london
Reviews.Content: I've been to Paris quite a lot over the past 10 years and in terms of location, price and quality the Hotel La Perle is my favourite. For the reasonable rate you get a very clean and good sized room, and for Paris a good sized bathroom. Everything was in good condition (walls, floors etc) and did not look shabby or unclean. Comfortable beds. For me the location is perfect, close to many metro stops and within walking distance of many places, and around the corner from the best shopping in Paris. The street it's on does have restaurants and bars on it and people were outside smoking, but we didn't find it noisy at night. If anything I liked the atmosphere. The only thing negative I have to say is that we were woken up in the mornings by hammering which seemed right beside our heads, but this was because our room was on the other side of the wall from the next building over, so this wasn't the hotel's fault. I will definitely go back to the Perle next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Regular at Hotel La Perle”
Reviews.Author: JJBNijmegen
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Paris, Hotel La Perle provides a five star experience for its service and welcoming staff. We would not think of staying anywhere else during our 4 to 5 visits a year to Paris. The Bouvard family

Reviews.Title: “Second time and cant wait for third”
Reviews.Author: JonyHome
Reviews.Content: We are a family with three young boys ages 7, 10 and 12. This was our second time at La Perle and we cant wait for the next time. The staff are extremely freindly, never say no to anything, and the rooms are exactly what you need, clean, comfortable and bathrooms are new. Location is excellent though rooms on main street could be nosiy at night especially on weekends, but this is easily adressable if you ask for a quite room.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay”
Reviews.Author: ladydecatur
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and decided to book after my agent recommended it. We found the rooms comfortable and very clean. The staff spoke english so it was easy to comunicate, plus they were eager to please. There was confusion on a triple room, so contact the hotel directly to make sure the room is large enough to sleep three adults. There is a metro station close so we used that and only used a taxi to check in and out. Area is very safe, with shopping and eating all around.

Reviews.Title: “All-around superb!”
Reviews.Author: Jathde
Reviews.Content: Every aspect of La Perle is excellent. Nice, well kept property, very professional and helpful staff, well appointed and clean rooms and a great location. The hotel is just a block from St. Sulpice cathedral (of Da Vinci Code fame) and very near two subway stops. Gobs of good restaurants and shopping, shopping, shopping within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Shoe shopping in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ShoeChic
Reviews.Content: Lovely very friendly hotel. Everyone smiles! - The rooms are simple, & nicely decorated with very comfortable beds & pillows. The hotel is very clean. Some of the rooms have exposed beams & have real charactor. The front of the hotel facing the street can be noisy, but the back is very quiet. The location is great. There are some very nice, trendy & very French bars & restaurants close by. The reception staff couldn't be more helpful. Always a lovely stay & very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “a pearl of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: tresexigeante
Reviews.Content: I know Paris( having lived there 20 years) and I know hotels,( having been in the business), and I loved the Hotel LaPerle! The 6th arrdt is very central and has both history and high fashion. Great Metro possibilities in close proximity. The hotel staff is friendly and competent. You get a real welcome. Super professional, and helpful; Lovely well appointed room with nice amenities super clean and although small the rooms are not tiny. This is Paris after all. Its three stars but to my thinking its a tiny 4 star!! Only the breakfast offerring seemed less that all it could be but then the French are not very Breakfast conscious. The Hotel LaPerle is an excellent choice for anyone with taste and a love of Paris at it's very best!

Reviews.Title: “Good, high recommended”
Reviews.Author: rat22
Reviews.Content: nice location (closed to metro by less than 3-mins walk) , great price, friendly staff, they freely upgraded my room when they know there may be a little problem. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A 14 year long realtionship with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ole-san
Reviews.Content: For 14 years I have been a regular customer at this Paris hotel. I have remained so loyal for several reasons: The personnel has changed very little and has the personal qualities of kindness and frioendliness that I usually only encounter in the hotels of the Far East. The quality of the rooms, beds, bedlinen, bathrooms and bathtowels are first calss. I find it very suited for writing and for relaxing when the day is over. The breakfast is - without being overwhelming - more thand adequate. As a diplomat I travel a lot and this is indeed my favorite Paris hotel without a doubt and I have recommended it to many friends. They have all loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: ekgf
Reviews.Content: Exceptional location in the heart of Paris within walking distance from most interesting sites. Close access to metro and bus. We chose this hotel more than 10 years ago and return for 3-4 times a year for several nights. There are many recommendable restaurants close by. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but very comfortable and charming; those facing the courtyard are amazingly quiet. The breakfast with fresh fruit juices and pastries is of high quality. We recommended this hotel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic-galleries”
Reviews.Author: rochlk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel La Perle for a couple of nights in Nov 2007. We liked it a lot. The staff, especially Lydia, is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small, but very cute and clean, the bathroom has a large bathtub. Location is excellent, within a walking distance to the best of the museums, galleries, boutique shopping and great surrounding places to eat. The price is very reasonable given the location. Ask for the courtyard side because the street side has something going on till 3 am., so it;s quite noisy at night The only thing that disappointed us was our friend left us a message that we have never received. We will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Pearle”
Reviews.Author: nothinlikeparis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Perle the end of September, 2007. The staff was amazingly helpful and friendly. We felt most welcome from the first time we entered the lobby. The rooms are clean but small. When you have the whole city of Paris to explore, a clean small room is everything you need!! There's also a tiny gift boutique in the lobby for last-minute purchases. Breakfast was filling and the hotel is very near to wonderful bistros, shopping and sites. We felt safe walking around the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are accurate”
Reviews.Author: Niaron
Reviews.Content: Other reviews are accurate, this is a lovely hotel, fantastic location. Staff very helpful but rooms facing the street are noisy. Asked for courtyard room but very late arrival so didn't get one. Streetside rooms are not quiet until about 3am, either join them or get the earplugs out!

Reviews.Title: “Fair to Poor Service; room and location fine”
Reviews.Author: FrancophileMa
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we had seen it on a prior trip and liked it. The service was disappointing. Our friends left us phone messages twice and stopped by to leave us a message and we received none of those 3 messages. So unfortunately we missed getting together with them in Paris. Also once at the front desk I asked for some assistance and the clerk without even looking up at me said they were too busy to help. Another time, I asked how the weather would be for the day and I was told to go to the elevator as it was posted inside.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Left Bank Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrMayor98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Perle for four nights in September and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We recommend the hotel highly because of its wonderful location in a marvelous Left Bank neighborhood, with good access to public transportation and within easy walking distance of almost all the tourist attractions. The neighborhood has excellent restaurants, cafes and brasseries virtually on every corner. The rooms are admittedly small, which is typical for this part of the city. Our room faced the courtyard and was both dark and quiet. If you place a high value on spacious, comfortable rooms, you should either seek a hotel in another part of the city or be prepared to spend a small fortune. Although small, our room was perfectly adequate and had beautiful wood-beamed ceilings. We would have appreciated a larger closet, and some of the furnishings were a bit tired. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. When we needed a taxi, they were able to produce it right on schedule. They all spoke English quite well and bent over backwards to make our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Scootoir
Reviews.Content: Based on Trip Advisor reviews we booked one night here before flying out of CDG airport. It presents a charming facade on a tiny Left Bank street and staff were very pleasant, helpful and multi-lingual. However we had a standard room furnished with chain motel quality furniture. It was clean but in need of refurbishing and had zero charm. Had a tiny flat-screen TV with poor picture quality on some stations, good storage, comfortable but low bed and very good sound proofing. Lots of bars and restaurants on the street so this was its saving grace. Bathroom had tub/shower combo with a shower curtain and decent counter storage. There was a step up to the tub which could be dangerous and made a long reach from the sink to a hand towel. Since we had a flight to make we had the buffet breakfast which had variety but was expensive. They could not make a decent cup of tea. We have stayed in 3 hotels in the 7th arrondissement over the past 10 years and any one of them would be a better value than La Perle.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: patandlew
Reviews.Content: La Perle is a wonderful hotel in a great location. Like most rooms in Paris, our room was small, but very well laid out. It was in the back, on the courtyard, and hence very quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful, arranging taxis, etc. Good breakfast at resonable price, and nice bar. Wireless access for a fee. The neighborhood has St. Sulpice, many fine restaurants, and several convenient Metro lines, plus it's an easy walk to the Louvre, Latin Quarter, Notre Dame, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: CAHappyboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 16 year wedding anniversary and stayed at Hotel La Perle from Sept. 21st until the 26th. The hotel staff first and foremost were fantastic. They were accomadating and helpful at every turn and made us feel welcome from the moment we entered the lobby. The hotel is situated in a fantastic, quaint neighborhood just off the main boulevard of Saint Germain which was within walking distance to most of the major sites and just a few blocks from the subway. The room was not too spacious but it was clean and quiet. We would definately stay again provided the chance!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis”
Reviews.Author: Zenobia1
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Hotel la Perle for about 7 or 8 years. I travel to Paris at least twice per year for about 5 days per visit. If you are looking for consistency in service, cleanliness, courtesy, value, coupled with a superb location, then Hotel la Perle is an excellent choice. An unusual attribute of la Perle is the tenure of the superior staff. Amin or Lydia will greet you at reception and will be wonderful at helping you navigate through the streets and restaurants and maze that makes Paris so unique. And the breakfast room/bar area is truly an oasis with all the natural light and friendly atmosphere enhanced by guests from all over the world. This is truly one of those "little gems". Barry - Montreal

Reviews.Title: “LOVED LA PERLE”
Reviews.Author: Alex1979
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a fantastic location. Staff breakfast and room fabulous. A little gem. Definitely an excellent base

Reviews.Title: “consistant”
Reviews.Author: kfer
Reviews.Content: We have many experiences of Paris hotels, so were not too concerned at the very small rooms at La Perle. The location is fantastic, so close to everything. Staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast courtyard area an added bonus. Paris hotels can sometimes be "very surprising", but at least at La Perle the staff all speak english, the food is consistant and the location is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: amcbeig
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at Hotel La Perle and enjoyed it very much. We had a superior room on the 5th floor overlooking the courtyard so noise was no problem. The room was small by US standards but how much time is one in their room in Paris. The front desk was very pleasant and helpful. Each day after sightseeing we would enjoy a glass of wine in the tiny bar and the bartender there was quite nice as well. Great location--walking distance to sights. Close to metro stops. Many good restaurants in the area. St. Suplice church and Blvd St. Germaine block away. Purchased museum pass from front desk--well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved La Perle!”
Reviews.Author: Tranquilina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Perle this past July and found it to be clean, comfortable and centrally located. The staff was friendly and most helpful in assisting us. Museums, good shopping, great cafes, churches, and the Seine are all within walking distance. We plan on returning to Paris and will definitely plan on staying at La Perle.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Stepstool1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July and loved it. Great location, close to everything - restaurants, attractions, shopping, etc. The staff was unfailingly helpful and friendly. The room was small by American standards, but we found that to be the case in virtually all European hotels in which we stayed. You get used to it. The room was in very good condition though - clean and well maintained. The A/C worked well during the hot nights. Good internet access in the lobby. Street-side rooms can be noisy at night. Request an interior facing room. We definitely felt the hotel offered good price-value and would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Travelling Australians”
Reviews.Author: alexandraAustralia
Reviews.Content: The last time I was in Paris I was single, 25 years ago, this time I retruned with my husband and 2 children 18 and 16 for 5 nights. The hotel is in a fabulous location just off Boulevard St. Germain in a one way street. The street can be noisy so request a courtyard outlook. There are wonderful reastaurants within 5 minutes of the hotel and the staff were very helpful in making reservations.The rooms are very small, but clean and if I returned I would book a deluxe room. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as the breakfast room looked bland and uninviting with packets of jam on the tables. I reccomend Pauls ( a patisserie/cafe chain and great value) or Les Deux Magots for breakfast both of which are a short walk from the hotel. The staff at the desk were not very friendly and on a couple of occasions I felt as though I should apologise for disturbing their day. A good laundry service but no iron in the room. I would reccomend this hotel but check location of room and if you are there for longer than 2 nights book a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, great location”
Reviews.Author: pidgey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in March, and while the decor was a bit outdated, we found the room to be clean and a decent-size. The staff was very nice, and the breakfast that they offer (not included in the price) was very good. Our third floor room overlooked the courtyard, and it was very quiet for our entire stay. The elevator was pretty tiny though, so if you have a lot of luggage, you may not be able to fit it all in the elevator at once. One kind of weird thing though: throughout our stay, the maintenance staff stowed the mop in the stairwell--maybe they don't expect people to use the stairs that often? The location was great, as it was within walking distance of several Metro stops. I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to say in the Saint-Germain area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located in the St. Germain district, very close by the subway, two bus lines and lots of restaurants. The hotel is surprisingly modern, and the room was very clean and up to date. We were very fortunate to have the only room on the bottom floor, and aside from hearing every time somebody flushed (it's an old city!) the room was quiet. Breakfast at 13 euros seemed a bit expensive, so we found a bakery about a block from the hotel and had delicious baked goods at a fraction of the cost. Overall a good value in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “rude staff”
Reviews.Author: gmtCapeCod
Reviews.Content: I am shocked to read other reviews saying how helpful the staff was. The front desk was anything but helpful. I spent 3 nights there and upon check in the room's air conditioning did not work. When we returned later that evening it still was not working. When I went back to the front desk the man working the desk came up to the room with me. The fact that the unit was blowing (hot air) meant to him that the air conditioning was working. When I asked about another room, none was available. I called my tour operator for suggestions and they spoke to the hotel, suddenly there was another room available. Air conditioning worked occassionally in the second room. When asking for bus number information we were told there was no buses to the Eifel Tower. Of course there are buses to the Eifel Tower. We were helped only when we questioned him and at that point we were a large inconvenience to him even though no one else was waiting at the desk. He was also rude about use of computer which is in very poor condition. Monitor is extremely difficult to read. Rooms were clean and hotel is in a good location but the staff at the reception desk were far from helpful. I would not stay here again nor would I suggest it to anyone. It might be a good hotel if you are part of a tour group and do not need any information or suggestions from the front desk (no concierge). Also small animals are allowed so a dog barking from the courtyard was not unusual early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome little place in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ALE1923
Reviews.Content: We just completed a stay at La Perle and it was a joy. We love to stay in the 6th when we're in Paris, and this was our 4th time in the last 6 years and our 4th hotel try. By far, the La Perle was the best of all. Hotel staff was VERY helpful and accommodating. The breakfast buffet looked quite complete and ran the typical hotel cost for the continental breakfast (we didn't eat there.) The location is fabulous... it is on a set of small one way streets that are more pedestrian than auto ready... and they're full of little bistros and restaurants, small boutiques and an english language bookstore. Our room was big for Paris and neither of us spent time crawling between the walls/desk/closets and bed to get around. Beyond the immediate location, the hotel is about 2 blocks from two different metro lines, close to two movie theaters, and not that far from the Luxembourg gardens. We were thrilled with our stay there and we both agreed we'd stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: DaveSacramento_CA
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the LaPerle in May & loved it! The location was perfect & really gave us the feeling of being in Paris - quaint street (limited car access) with many wonderful cafes & shops to choose from. Also great access to the metro bus & subway lines. We found the staff to be very, very accommodating, the room highly adequate (altho not large by U.S. standards), very comfortable beds & bedding and overall excellent service. One tip - ask for the upgrade to superior room so it will be on the inner court. Our room was on the 5th floor over the inner court & was exceptionally quiet - but we overheard other guests saying their room on the hotel front was noisy in the evenings due to people in the cafes across the street. If we get to go to Paris again, we will definitely stay at the LaPerle. We arrived very early from our U.S. flight (7:30 a.m.) and didn't expect to be able to do anything other than store our luggage until later in the day, but they welcomed us warmly, invited us to partake of their breakfast, fixed us much-needed coffee, & had us in our room within an hour! Also, their recommendations for restaurants, etc. were great. They even went out of the way to mail us a scarf we had inadvertently left when we checked out. Dave & Linda Sacramento, CA

Reviews.Title: “Perfect La Perle”
Reviews.Author: porgie
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three day stay at this small hotel. We prefer more intimate hotels such as this one as we enjoy the personal service and contacts with the staff. We had (as well as our travel companions) a room on the street. Both rooms were large and had wonderful and clean barhrooms. It was a bit noisy in the evening with the noisy customers across the way enjoying themselves. My husband actually enjoyed the chatter. We had the casement windows open. When we closed them the sounds were hardly noticable. Two things that were exceptional about La Perle were the location of the hotel and the staff. We speak no French at all and were concerned after hearing so many stories about the rude French. Much to our delight we found that NOT to be the case at all. The staff went out of thier way to make arrangements for us with care. The location of the hotel is on a small side street, almost the size of an alley. There were numerous restaurants in the immediate area. Each one we visited had wonderful food and friendly service.We have always heard how beautiful Paris was and now we can agree. It is also the cleanest city Wwe have ever visited. They power wash the sidewalks/streets several times a week!

Reviews.Title: “La Perl is a Pearl”
Reviews.Author: heme34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at La Perle May, 07-had 2 rooms on the courtyard. Was quiet and commfortable. Service and personnel were very kind and helpful to us. The location near St. Sulpice church and Blvd St. Germain was perfect-lots of reasonable places to eat right on that street or very close by. We enjoyed our stay there and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Hotel La Perle for the Price Range”
Reviews.Author: OC_Traveler27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned froma 4 night stay at the Hotel La Perle (May 14-18th, 2007). We paid $185 euro per night for a superior double room facing the courtyard. Though the room is small, as most rooms in this price range are in Paris, it was quite clean and the location was great. It's located on a very quaint street with boutiques, restaurants, pubs and creperies. On a side note, there is a wonderful little Italian pizza place across the street from the hotel (Pizza Positano) that serves authentic Neapolitan pizza nd pasta. Delicious! We ate there twice. Good shopping in the surrounding areas and walking distance to many key sights. About a 15 min. walk to Notre Dame and 5-10 min. walk to Luxembourg Gardens, St. Sulpice, etc. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Our only complaint would be that the walls are very, very thin and you can hear everything going on in the hallways or in the room next to you. You can't hear any street noise from the room which is quite nice but we were woken up fairly early (6 or 7 a.m.) on several mornings either by the guests in the next room or by maids cleaning, couldn't quite tell. For the price range and location, I would recommend it. The area has a lot of character and overall, we enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location & decent value for Paris, but still disappointing”
Reviews.Author: IPGHK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in early May, as part of my continuing search for a decent hotel for single travellers (i.e. small room acceptable) under EUR150/night near St Germain. Though I got a great price (for Paris) on the hotel website, I was still disappointed in the overall quality of the hotel & would definitively not return. Pros: Absolutely fantastic location, within a 10 min walk of 3 metro lines, great restaurants/bars/cafes, shopping, 20 mins to major museums & the right bank. Room was of decent size & kept very clean, no smoking odors. Most of staff helpful & friendly. Quick check-in/out procedure. Cons: Unprofessional staff behavior - when I arrived, the cleaning staff were having a huge screaming row downstairs, which could be clearly heard throughout the lobby. This continued for 30 mins; no one did anything to stop it. The staff (I never ate here but the guest computer is right next to the breakfast room) simply threw the silverware into the cutlery trays every morning, making an awful noise. The walls of my room were so thin I could hear every guest on my floor coming & going. The shower pressure was so weak as to be laughable, & the temperature fluctuations were painful. My minibar was only refilled 3 out of the 5 days (I was almost never in the room). The guest computer didn't work well & there was no printer, which was inconvenient. Overall the place just seemed a bit shabby & poorly managed, which is enough to put me off staying there again. I preferred the nearby Hotel de Fleurie, which is in the same price range, but I'd still try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CottageCruisers
Reviews.Content: April 2007 Aussie Tourists We decided to stay at the La Perle after reading good reviews on Trip Advisor. The location was fantastic, the staff friendly and helpful and the room a good size, as we took the hint and booked a room facing the courtyard. The courtyard rooms are not only a bit bigger but also quiet and we were never woken by noise during our 5 night stay. The staff as mentioned were very good and our limited French was never a problem. The location we thought exceptional as Metro stations were close by, hundreds of restaurants within the square kilometer and the Seine merely a 10 minute walk. Although we wouldn't class the hotel as inexpensive we thought it to be good value for Paris, a classy establishment in an up market location which added to a wonderful April break in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerFromLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a weekend in Paris. The hotels I usually stay in were full (this was a last minute trip) so I did my research and stumbled upon this excellent spot. The location is great - very close to both St Germain des Pres and Mabillon metro stops. It's a few steps from St Sulpice, from the Marche St Germain, and from all the other wonderful places in the 5th and 6th arrondissements. There are some excellent restaurants in the vicinity if you don't want to venture far, but, as well as location, this hotel has the benefit of friendly staff and very clean, comfortable rooms. This is Paris, so don't expect a room the size of a ballroom...however, we had a small double room which was big enough for two people. The green curtains and green bathroom were slighly outdated, but as mentioned before, spotlessly clean and the water pressure was better than in some 5* hotels I've stayed in! I will definitely stay at La Perle again, and will recommend it to friends who visit Paris as a perfect base for a short trip to the city. Ask for a room facing the courtyard (quiet).

Reviews.Title: “A Left Bank Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Chatwin70
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris many times. My girlfriend and I went together for the first time in August of 2006 and stayed for 6 nights. It was truly a wonderful experience. Our room was facing the courtyard area, which we requested so that we wouldn't have to deal with any street noise. Turns out that the street it's on, Rue des Canettes, is tiny and very quiet. They have a small bar/restaurant that has about 6 tables and is very cute and efficient. The room was on the small side, but totally functional and very comfortable: small flat-screen cable TV hanging on the wall, two big French door windows, hair dryer installed in the bathroom wall. The hotel is immaculately well-kept and the staff was very friendly and happy to help us with directions or making restaurant reservations for us. It is in the midst of a great neighborhood for shops and cafes around St. Germain-des-Pres. I would highly recommend this gem and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “La Perle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynnie2pockets
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at La Perle for four nights in March and we would like to recommend it to travellers. We had read the reviews and found them to be accurate and helpful in our decision to stay there. The location was excellent and the room was very good. The only problem was the use of two beds pushed together and single doonas for a double bed . The bathroom was very good and everything was clean. the staff were helpful and friendly. We had a wonderful stay for our first trip to Paris. L. Stevens Australia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice, very well located”
Reviews.Author: flozano
Reviews.Content: Overall I can say this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in Paris. Quite big rooms and bathrooms (very hard to find in Paris) , everything very neat and clean, helpful staff. Very well located in the heart of Saint Germain des Pres.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel La Perle
HotelInfo.Address: 14, rue des Canettes | 6e arr., 75006 Paris, France
